summary: This is an email correspondence regarding a scheduled court hearing in the case of United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. The hearing was ordered to address the proposed nolle prosequi order following Epstein's death, and will allow victims and their counsel to be heard. It provides logistical details including date, time, judge, and location.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: A hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, in the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
The hearing was to address a nolle prosequi order proposed by the United States Attorney on August 19, 2019.
Victims and their counsel were given the opportunity to be heard at the hearing before Judge Richard M. Berman.
The hearing was set to take place at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse in New York City.
